1:
Wine is a mocker and strong drink is a brawler;\q whoever is led astray by drink is not wise.
\q
2:
The fear of a king is like the fear of a young lion that is roaring;\q the one who makes him angry forfeits his life.


\q
3:
It is an honor for anyone to avoid conflict,\q but every fool jumps into an argument.
\q
4:
The lazy person does not plow in autumn;\q he seeks a crop at harvest time but will have nothing.


\q
5:
The purpose in a human heart is like deep water,\q but someone with understanding will draw it out.
\q
6:
Many a person proclaims he is loyal,\q but who can find one who is faithful?


\q
7:
The righteous person walks in his integrity,\q and his sons who follow after him will be blessed.
\q
8:
A king who sits on the throne performing the duties of a judge\q is winnowing with his eyes all the evil that is before him.


\q
9:
Who can say, "I have kept my heart pure;\q I am clean from my sin"?
\q
10:
Differing weights and unequal measures—\q Yahweh hates them both.


\q
11:
Even a youth is known by his actions,\q by whether his conduct is pure and upright.
\q
12:
Ears that hear and eyes that see—\q Yahweh made them both.


\q
13:
Do not love sleep or you will come to poverty;\q open your eyes and you will have plenty to eat.
\q
14:
"Bad! Bad!" says the buyer,\q but when he goes away he boasts.


\q
15:
There is gold and an abundance of costly stones,\q but lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
\q
16:
Take a garment of one who has put up security for a stranger,\q and hold it in pledge when he puts up security for an immoral woman.


\q
17:
Bread gained by deceit tastes sweet,\q but afterward his mouth will be full of gravel.
\q
18:
Plans are established by advice\q and only with wise guidance should you wage war.


\q
19:
A gossip reveals secrets\q and so you should not associate with people who talk too much.
\q
20:
If a person curses his father or his mother,\q his lamp will be snuffed out in the middle of darkness.


\q
21:
An inheritance gained quickly at the beginning\q will do less good in the end.
\q
22:
Do not say, "I will pay you back for this wrong!"\q Wait for Yahweh and he will rescue you.


\q
23:
Yahweh hates unequal weights\q and dishonest scales are not good.
\q
24:
A person's steps are directed by Yahweh;\q how then can he understand his way?


\q
25:
It is a snare for a person to say rashly, "This thing is holy,"\q and begin to think about what it means only after making his vow.
\q
26:
A wise king winnows the wicked\q and he turns a threshing wheel over them.


\q
27:
The spirit of a person is the lamp of Yahweh,\q searching all his inmost parts.
\q
28:
Covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness preserve the king;\q his throne is made secure by love.


\q
29:
The glory of young men is their strength\q and the splendor of old people is their gray hair.
\q
30: Blows that make a wound cleanse away evil\q and beatings make the innermost parts clean.
